results.title: Stadium
results.brief_description:
Short experimental film capturing the atmosphere of Melbourne’s iconic MCG stadium at night whilst hosting a soccer match during the 2000 Sydney Olympics.
No commentary, using sound effects only.

results.title: Not really morning people
results.creator_credit: Renee Rutgrink and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Can’t handle Mondays? Don’t think you can get out of bed tomorrow? Perhaps you’re not really a morning person. A cheeky tour into our morning journeys guided by a couple of observant experts we never really notice.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Renee Rutgrink and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television

results.title: Harvey
results.creator_credit: Peter McDonald, Priscilla Collins, Rachel Roberts and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A dark tale of obsession and loneliness about a man searching for physical and emotional completeness. It is only when he thinks he has achieved this goal through the unwilling coalescence of his neighbour that he begins to understand the painful, irresolvable nature of his obsession. Stars Nicholas Hope as Harvey and Lisa Angove as Lily.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter McDonald, Priscilla Collins, Rachel Roberts and AFTRS

results.title: Security
results.creator_credit: Renee Rutgrink and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: They are everywhere, shops, pubs, offices, but we never really notice them. Security guards. Sentinels of public order. Who are they? Cardboard cut-out muscle-men? Or real people? This short documentary about security guards Tunc and Fahim, briefly dips beyond the uniform to reveal their attitudes to both work and life, where they are from and where they are going.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Renee Rutgrink and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television

results.title: Flying over mother
results.creator_credit: Michael James Rowland, Melanie Coombs and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
1. Vladimir is growing up on an isolated farm somewhere on the Russian Steppes. He has been brought up on his mother’s stories of all the dangers that lie in wait for boys who misbehave and he is trying - not very successfully - to overcome his fears. But one day something happens that will change the direction of his life.
  2. Vladimir has finally reached his goal - he has trained as a cosmonaut and is circling the earth. But unfortunately his capsule has malfunctioned and things don’t look so good for him…

results.title: Turn me on: the history of the vibrator
results.creator_credit: Catherine Chauchat, Warwick Burton and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Turn Me On explores the history of the vibrator. Through a group of sexpert characters, the documentary uncovers the socially camouflaged sex toy - hidden in the underwear drawer since it was invented over 120 years ago. Turn Me On reveals a social and sexual history that some people would prefer remained a secret.
